content.description: Look for three bolts to get established into the main weakness above. An athletic move guards the top. Either gear anchor in the horizontal up there, or a small, but sturdy, tree can be slung for the anchor.
content.protection: Single to 3" is plenty sufficient. 2x single 60m raps off the summit rap rings will get you to the ground.
content.location: Route lies just to the right of the chasm between Carnivore Pinnacle and Lappy McDome.

content.description: Oh man, this thing will get all the stars with some traffic and some cleaning up. Pure joy as is! Sustained and technical the whole way. It ain't over until it's over. I felt like I used about ever kind of face move on this thing you could imagine.
content.protection: 18 draws will suffice, bolted anchor at the top or you can continue to the tree at the top of Treat Me and sling that. 2x single 60m raps off of the rap anchors to the north will get you to the ground.
content.location: Just to the right of Treat Me! Look for the large boulder almost leaning against the wall. Love Lettuce begins to the left of this boulder.

content.description: This route follows discontinuous cracks up the left side of Carnivore Pinnacle.  There is a section of unprotected 5.6 between the 2nd and third cracks.  The route shares a finish with Unnamed 5.11 and Consolation Prize, up the 5.8 finger crack.
content.location: Start in the large gully on the left side of the pinnacle.  Descend by downclimbing the back side (easy fifth class).

content.description: Another awesome route, had to post it. Stem over from the boulder and launch into wonderful thin face climbing which leads to a daunting roof (manageable) where the route veers right to continue up the face. Sustained and technical with multiple cruxes, this one will have you whooping and hollering by the top.
content.protection: 18 bolts and bolted anchor, 2x single 60m raps from the rap anchors on the summit get you to the ground
content.location: Starts from on top of the large boulder that's butted up against the face. To the right of Love Lettuce

content.description: The first pitch starts on face, then thin hands, followed by some offwidth, to a nice large belay ledge.  The second pitch joins Unnamed 5.11 and follows the finger crack to the summit.   This route is between routes 'B' and 'C' on Kerry's topo.   Bob Kerry's topo
content.location: This route is the first to the left of the large chimney that seperates the Carnivore Pinnacle from Lappy Mcdome.

content.description:
This is a less-visited area adjacent to the Sheepshead, with quality rock, and 2-pitch routes.  The approach is not much longer than that of the Sheepshead and the Crisis Center, but is fifth class.  These rocks provide a good alternative if the Sheepshead has a crowd. 

Bob Kerry's topo
